edu.frontrange.csc240.a8

Class Controller

  • Object
    • edu.frontrange.csc240.a8.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends Object
    The Controller is used to interpret actions taken by the user on the View. It contains the logic for inputs that happen on the View and for passing data on to the Model. It performs its own validation (such as the format of the entered numbers) or by informing the user of any problems found by the Model.
    Version:
    2.0, 2016-10-15, Assignment 8, Exercise 12.13
    Author:
    Dr. Bruce K. Haddon, Instructor

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  Controller.SelectionButton
      Specialized representation of a radio button for use in the temperature panel, wrapping Scale as the selected item.
      private class  Controller.SelectionCombo
      Specialized representation of a combo box for use in the temperature panel, wrapping a Scale value as the selected item.

      • FORMAT

        private static final String FORMAT
        Format for displaying non-integral values on the View
        See Also:

      • MAXIMUM_BUTTONS

        private static final int MAXIMUM_BUTTONS
        The maximum number of buttons to use, otherwise use a combo box. The number of buttons determined by looking at width of produced box.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • createSelectors

        private java.util.List<javax.swing.JComponent> createSelectors(boolean from)
        Set up the method of selection of the temperature scales. If there is a large number (greater than the allowed MAXIMUM_BUTTONS), use a combo box, otherwise use a row of radio buttons.
        Parameters:
        from - indicates whether these selectors are for the "from" scales, otherwise the "to" scales.
        Returns:
        a list of the selector components

      • formatted

        private String formatted(double value)
        If the value is an actual integral value, format as an integer, otherwise format according to the definition of FORMAT.
        Parameters:
        value - a vale to represent
        Returns:
        a String representation

      • inputValue

        private void inputValue()
        When the input is changed, if possible, convert the input field into a standard format for display in the converted temperature.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if the value is not acceptable in format
        IllegalArgumentException - if the input scale is not consistent with the current set temperature and output scale

      • setSelectedScale

        private void setSelectedScale(Scale scale,
                              boolean from)
        Given a scale selected by a selector, inform the model, and cause an update of values.
        Parameters:
        scale - the selected scale
        from - true if this is a "from" scale, otherwise a "to" scale
